overview: This bill transfers the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office from the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to the Office of Enterprise Technology Services in the Department of Accounting and General Services. [1] It also establishes the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Special Fund. [1] The measure appropriates funds to support the office and the newly created special fund. [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $200,000 (HB934_.HTM.txt) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 to be deposited into the broadband and digital equity special fund. [1] There is also appropriated out of the broadband and digital equity special fund the sum of $200,000 (HB934_.HTM.txt) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for the purposes of the fund. [1] The sum appropriated shall be expended by the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office for the purposes of this Act. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided legislative documents do not specify the assumptions, cost estimation methods, or data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this measure. [1] The bill appropriates specific amounts for fiscal year 2025-2026 without detailing the underlying methodology for these figures. [1] No references to comparable programs or historical budgets are included in the text to explain the basis for the appropriation amounts. [1]
agency_impact: All rights, powers, functions, and duties of the department of business, economic development, and tourism relating to the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office are transferred to the department of accounting and general services. [1] Employees who occupy civil service positions and whose functions are transferred shall retain their civil service status, whether permanent or temporary. [1] All appropriations, records, equipment, machines, files, supplies, contracts, books, papers, documents, maps, and other personal property will also be transferred with the functions to which they relate. [1] [1]
economic_impact: The Hawaii broadband and digital equity office shall develop and implement specific strategies and plans to aggressively increase broadband affordability, penetration, and competitive availability in the State. [1] The office will support the efforts of both public and private entities to enhance or facilitate the deployment of and access to competitively priced, advanced electronic communications services. [1] It will also administer grant programs in support of broadband infrastructure, innovation, and the digital economy. [1]
policy_impact: This measure transfers the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office from the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to the Office of Enterprise Technology Services. [1] The bill establishes the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Special Fund to be administered by the Hawaii broadband and digital equity office. [1] Additionally, the bill repeals Chapter 206S, Hawaii Revised Statutes. [1]
revenue_sources: The broadband and digital equity special fund will be deposited with proceeds of leases of broadband infrastructure owned by the State, appropriations by the legislature, and gifts, donations, and grants from public agencies and private persons. [1] [1] This bill appropriates $200,000 (HB934_.HTM.txt) out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii for fiscal year 2025-2026 for deposit into the fund. [1] All interest earned or accrued on moneys deposited into the special fund shall become a part of the special fund. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: For fiscal year 2025-2026, the bill appropriates $200,000 (HB934_.HTM.txt) from general revenues to be deposited into the broadband and digital equity special fund. [1] An additional sum of $200,000 (HB934_.HTM.txt) is appropriated out of the special fund for the same fiscal year. [1] The special fund is intended for ongoing uses, including supporting broadband projects, defraying internet service costs, and funding personnel positions. [1] Future revenues for the fund may come from legislative appropriations, leases of state-owned broadband infrastructure, and grants or donations. [1] [1] The transfer of employees will occur without loss of salary, seniority, or other benefits. [1] However, the bill does not provide a fiscal projection for the subsequent five years. [1] The comptroller may prescribe the duties and qualifications of transferred employees and fix their salaries without regard to chapter 76, Hawaii Revised Statutes. [1] Subsequent changes in employee status may be made pursuant to applicable civil service and compensation laws. [1] The provided text does not contain information about program expansion or recurring expenses beyond the initial appropriation. [1] Therefore, the specific fiscal implications beyond fiscal year 2025-2026 are indeterminate. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The measure establishes the broadband and digital equity special fund, which will receive revenues. [1] These revenues include proceeds of leases of broadband infrastructure owned by the State, as well as gifts, donations, and grants from public agencies and private persons. [1] All interest earned or accrued on moneys deposited into the special fund shall become a part of the special fund. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: The provided documents do not outline any specific new capital expenditures. [1] Moneys in the broadband and digital equity special fund shall be used for supporting broadband projects, but details on capital investments are not provided. [1] The bill mandates the transfer of existing equipment, machines, and other personal property, but does not appropriate funds for new capital purchases. [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The ongoing fiscal obligations after six years will depend on future legislative appropriations and the office's ability to actively seek out funding from public and private sources. [1] The broadband and digital equity special fund is established as a continuing funding mechanism for its designated purposes. [1] The long-term fiscal sustainability of the office and its projects will rely on revenues generated from leases, grants, donations, and any future appropriations. [1] [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The provided documents do not contain a previous fiscal note for this measure. [1] Therefore, a summary of updates or changes cannot be provided. [1]
